article.headline: Wis.-Milwaukee 84, Detroit 81
article.story: DETROIT -- Tone Boyle scored 24 points, including five straight in overtime to give Wisconsin-Milwaukee the lead for good, and the Panthers rallied to edge Detroit 84-81 Saturday. Boyle's 3-pointer with 1:16 left in OT put Wisconsin-Milwaukee (7-8, 2-2 Horizon League) up 81-79. He added two free throws with 25 seconds remaining to push the lead to four, and the Panthers held on for the win. Kaylon Williams hit a 3-pointer with 1 second left in regulation to force overtime and finished with 17 points. Nick Minnerath scored a career-high 21 for the Titans (8-7, 2-1), who led 69-65 with 1:56 to play in the second half. Ray McCallum added 20 points. After Boyle hit two foul shots to make it a one-point game with 5 seconds remaining, McCallum pushed Detroit's advantage to 73-70 with two free throws one second later, leaving just enough time for Williams to send it to OT.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
